bill_title: provide certain defenses to adverse possession claims.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to provide certain defenses to adverse possession claims. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. That chapter 15-3 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: No person claiming title to real property by adverse possession may prevail against an owner of record if the owner of record has regularly paid all taxes legally assessed on such property unless: (1) The adverse possessor has also regularly paid all taxes legally assessed on such property; and (2) Possession of the property by the adverse possessor has been open, notorious, and continuous for twenty years; and (3) The owner of record had actual knowledge of the adverse possessor's open possession of the property; and (4) The owner of record took no action during the twenty years of open possession to contest the adverse possessor's exercise of dominion. Section 2. That chapter 15-3 be amended by adding a NEW SECTION to read: No person claiming title to real property by adverse possession may prevail against an owner of record if: (1) The adverse possessor was the owner of property directly bordering property of the owner of record; and (2) The possession and dominion exercised by the adverse possessor extended uniformly along the boundary line in a manner indicating that the two parties were mutually mistaken about the location of the actual boundary line between the properties.
